thread.title: Video: Dave Dobbyn weighs in on the All Blacks' Rugby World Cup hopes
thread.title_full: Video: Dave Dobbyn weighs in on the All Blacks' Rugby World Cup hopes

title: Video: Dave Dobbyn weighs in on the All Blacks' Rugby World Cup hopes
text:
Europe Correspondent 
Saturday 24 Oct 2015 2:35 p.m. 
Kiwi musician Dave Dobbyn is in the UK ahead of the All Blacks' Rugby World Cup semi-final – and he rates our chances against the Springboks. 
The music legend says he expects the All Blacks to be playing in the final – and he'll be there to witness us reach it after being gifted free tickets to watch them at Twickenham tomorrow. 
"This team is looking so scary and so on form – I think it's going to be an Australia-New Zealand final and I think it's going to be hard-fought all the way," Dobbyn said. 
"It always is, especially at this level. We're really excited – there's a great spirit with all the supporters over here going for it, and [we're] feeling more brave than we did four years ago." 
Discussing the Rugby World Cup final before the semi-final has even been played is a dangerous exercise – but Dobbyn says he feels confident the All Blacks will beat the Springboks. 
"I think it'll just be joyous. It'll be a dodgy first half but the points will hit the board. The All Blacks are definitely on form," he said. 
Watch the video above.
